title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.5 - Waiver of written test
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.5 - Waiver of written test

State Regulations

In addition to any other tests required, an applicant for a
license, other than a renewal license, shall be required to pass a test with
respect to the laws relating to traffic, the laws relating to driving while
ability impaired, the ability to read and comprehend traffic signs and symbols, except that such written test shall be waived: (a) if the applicant was formerly a resident
of another state, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico, the Canal Zone
or a province of Canada and has become a resident of this State, and is or was, within one year prior to the date of application for a New York license, the
holder of a valid license issued by the motor vehicle authority of his former
residence; or
(b) [
Reserved
]
(c) if
the applicant is applying for an original license after revocation of a prior

New York license, provided that application is made within two years from the
date subject was last validly licensed in this State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
8.5

Amended, New

York State Register August 27, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 34, eff. 8/27/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
